content.user_title: Analyze biological sequences and diversity metrics
content.value_statement: Working with DNA, RNA, and protein sequences requires specialized tools for alignment, phylogenetic analysis, and statistical testing. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for using scikit-bio to process biological data, calculate diversity metrics, and perform ordination analysis.
actual_capabilities: Read and write FASTA, FASTQ, GenBank, and Newick biological file formats
Perform pairwise and multiple sequence alignments using dynamic programming
Calculate alpha diversity (Shannon, Simpson, Faith PD) and beta diversity (Bray-Curtis, UniFrac) metrics
Construct and analyze phylogenetic trees with UPGMA, Neighbor Joining, and Robinson-Foulds distances
Run statistical tests including PERMANOVA, ANOSIM, and Mantel tests on biological data
Perform ordination analysis (PCoA, CCA, RDA) for visualizing high-dimensional biological data
limitations: This skill provides guidance only - users must install scikit-bio separately via pip
Large datasets require memory management techniques like generators and sparse formats
Phylogenetic metrics require a valid phylogenetic tree with matching OTU IDs
Does not perform de novo sequence assembly or variant calling

use_cases.title: Microbiome Diversity Analysis
use_cases.description: Calculate alpha and beta diversity from OTU tables, perform PCoA visualization, and test group differences with PERMANOVA.

use_cases.title: Sequence Processing Pipeline
use_cases.description: Read FASTQ files, filter by quality, find motifs, translate to protein, and export to FASTA format.

use_cases.title: Phylogenetic Tree Analysis
use_cases.description: Build trees from distance matrices, compare tree topologies with Robinson-Foulds metrics, and identify common ancestors.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Sequence Check
prompt_templates.scenario: Read and analyze a DNA sequence
prompt_templates.prompt: Use scikit-bio to read a DNA sequence from a FASTA file and show its reverse complement, transcribe to RNA, and find all start codon motifs.

prompt_templates.title: Diversity Calculation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use scikit-bio to calculate Shannon and Simpson alpha diversity indices from a sample-by-feature counts matrix, then compute Bray-Curtis beta diversity distances.

prompt_templates.title: Phylogenetic Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use scikit-bio to read a Newick tree file, shear it to specific taxa, calculate patristic distances between two nodes, and compare it to another tree using Robinson-Foulds distance.

prompt_templates.title: Statistical Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Use scikit-bio to run a PERMANOVA test on a distance matrix with a grouping variable, report the test statistic and p-value, and explain how to interpret the results.

output_examples.input: Calculate microbiome diversity from my OTU table
output: Alpha diversity: Shannon index, Simpson index, observed OTUs, Faith's PD
Beta diversity: Bray-Curtis, Jaccard, weighted/unweighted UniFrac
PERMANOVA: Test if groups differ significantly (p < 0.05)
PCoA: Visualize sample relationships in reduced dimensions

best_practices: Use generators (skbio.io.read) instead of loading entire files for large sequence datasets
Pre-filter and rarefy count data before diversity calculations to avoid bias
Validate that tree tip names match OTU IDs exactly before phylogenetic diversity analysis
Use 999+ permutations for robust PERMANOVA p-values
anti_patterns: Using relative abundances instead of integer counts for diversity metrics
Running PERMANOVA without checking dispersion homogeneity (run PERMDISP first)
Attempting to align pre-aligned sequences without degapping first
Loading entire large FASTA files into memory instead of using streaming generators

faq.question: Does this skill work with QIIME 2 artifacts?
faq.answer: Yes, scikit-bio reads BIOM tables, Newick trees, and distance matrices exported from QIIME 2.

faq.question: What sequence formats are supported?
faq.answer: FASTA, FASTQ, GenBank, EMBL, QSeq for sequences. Newick for trees. BIOM (HDF5/JSON) for tables.

faq.question: How do I install scikit-bio?
faq.answer: Run: uv pip install scikit-bio. Requires Python 3.9 or later.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance. Data is processed locally when you run the code.

faq.question: Why is my PERMANOVA giving unexpected results?
faq.answer: Check dispersion with PERMDISP first. PERMANOVA can give false positives when group dispersions differ.

faq.question: How does this compare to Biopython?
faq.answer: Scikit-bio focuses on ecology and statistics. Biopython has broader sequence utilities. They work well together.
